backpack.description: We dug the baby backpack out of storage. We haven't put many miles on it, though:  it's kind of hard to go hiking with Felix in tow.
backpack.title: Backpack

blow.description: Felix used to know how to blow his nose but somehow he forgot. He inhales instead. We tried to teach him with the help of a candle ("blow the candle with your nose!"). Good thing he doesn't have nose hair, or he would have burned it when he inhaled the flame.
blow.title: Blow

castle.description: Lucie and Felix built a castle out of cardboard. The princess is ALWAYS in the highest tower; she ALWAYS gets rescued by Buzz Lightyear (not pictured).
castle.title: Castle

chicken.description: To keep Milo entertained at meal times we give him something to sink his gums into. This week, chicken bones and carrots were a hit.
chicken.title: Chicken

climb.description: Oh no, he can climb! We need a baby gate for our stairs soon.
climb.title: Climb

drawers.description: Milo is crawling everywhere now. He goes from room to room, looking for trouble.
drawers.title: Drawers

garden1.description: Spring is here! The flowers are blooming and the babies are smiling.
garden1.title: Garden 1

garden2.description: Yes, to yall out there covered in snow, it IS actually warm enough here for a swim in the garden. Disgusting, isn't it? God Bless California.
garden2.title: Garden 2

laugh2.description: Something to do with lego robots and fart jokes -- two topics of universal, enduring interest in this household.
laugh2.title: Laugh 2

lego1.description: Felix could play lego all day every day. He loves to tell Dad or Mom to build intricate constructions, like the cargo airplane pictured here. Felix is a micro-manager at heart ("no, no, the cargo goes on the bottom, the pilot goes on top. Uses THIS piece for the tail").
lego1.title: Lego 1

lego2.description: What's a baby to do when your brother won't let you chew on his lego robots?
lego2.title: Lego 2

torin1.description:
Torin's 3 year-old birthday party at Codornices Park. It was her sister Kora's 5 year-old birthday party as well, but the poor dear was sick.

Torin liked her cake.
torin1.title: Torin 1

torin2.description: Torin's mom Cindee helps Felix pull a string from their home-made piñata. One of these strings is magic -- pulling it will break the piñata open.
torin2.title: Torin 2

torin3.description: When the piñata breaks, there's a mad dash for the candy.   Felix is such a sweet kid: he picked only 3 candies:  one for him, one for dad, and one for mom (Milo is TOO small).
torin3.title: Torin 3

torin4.description: Kids crawling over one another are funny.
torin4.title: Torin 4

description:
It's hard to believe that just a week ago we had the heater on, 3/4 of the family was sick, and the boys were grumpy little beasts. The weather has been beautiful in the last few days, and the boys have been healthy and charming. Let's hope it lasts!

Milo is increasingly mobile. He is exploring the house, crusing for a bruising.

Felix has a lot of imagination. He tells us about the robot that lives in his head, chews his food, and sends food bags into his belly. He tells us about his dreams, where he got scared because noone was picking him up from school. He says he is going to sing us a song about an alien who draws pictures for his friend far away, then takes off to Planet Earth with a visiting cosmonaut.
title: March 6
